intro: Carex simpliciuscula subsp. simpliciuscula, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves that are typically arranged in three rows, forming a cylindrical stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets, which are clustered at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Carex simpliciuscula subsp. simpliciuscula is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
